text: قال وما علمى بما كانوا۟ يعملون

translations.translation: He said: "It is not for me to know what they were doing.
Noah said: "What knowledge do I have about their deeds?
(Noah) said, "I have no knowledge of their deeds.
He said, “What do I know what their deeds are?”
He said: "And what knowledge have I of what they used to do"
He said: And what knowledge have I of what they do?
He said, 'What knowledge have I of that they have been doing?
He said: And what knowledge have I of what they may have been doing (in the past)?
He said, "What knowledge do I have of their doings?
He said: I have no knowledge of that which they have been Working.
He said, ‘What do I know as to what they used to do?
He said: "And what do I know as to what they do?
He said: "And what knowledge have I of what they used to do?
He said: 'I have no knowledge of what they have done.
He said, “What do I know about what they do?
He said, "And what is my knowledge of what they used to do?
[26:112] He said, ‘And what do I know of what they may have been doing?
(He said) Noah said: (And what knowledge have I of what they may have been doing (in the past)) I do not know whether it is you or them who will agree with me?

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: لذلك { قَالَ } نوح مشتيكاً إلى الله، مفوضاً { وَمَا عِلْمِي } وإدراكي محيطاً { بِمَا كَانُواْ يَعْمَلُونَ } [الشعراء: 112] ويأملون في نفوسهم من أي غرض وسبب يؤمنون بي ويمتثلون بأمري؛ إذ ما لي اطلاع على ضمائرهم وسرائرهم، بل بظواهرهم

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text: { قال وما عِلْمِي } أي: وأيّ شيء علمي { بما كانوا يعملون } من الصناعات، إنما أطلب منهم الإيمان
